repo_notes.content: DisTube is a comprehensive Discord music bot library built for Discord.js. Documentation should prioritize library users (developers building bots), focusing on installation, basic usage, and the public API. All user-facing guides must be kept simple and follow a reference style. Avoid deep technical dives in getting started guides. Complex internal workflows (e.g., Initialization Flow, Playback Workflow) MUST be documented ONLY in the "Internal Architecture" section, not in user guides.
repo_notes.author: Skick

pages.title: Project Overview
pages.purpose: Provide a high-level introduction to DisTube, its key features, and why it's a great choice for Discord music bots.

page_notes.content: Highlight support for various sources via plugins and built-in audio filters.

pages.title: Installation
pages.purpose: Step-by-step guide for installing DisTube and its necessary dependencies like FFmpeg and encryption libraries.

page_notes.content: Keep this simple. Show how to play, stop, and skip. Do NOT include initialization diagrams or internal workflow steps.

pages.title: Handling Events
pages.purpose: Explain how to listen to and handle DisTube events like 'playSong', 'addSong', 'error', etc.

pages.title: Public API Reference
pages.purpose: Detailed documentation of the classes and types that developers interact with most frequently.

page_notes.content: Focus on public methods and properties of exported classes.

pages.title: DisTube Class
pages.purpose: Comprehensive reference for the main DisTube class, its constructor options, and main methods like play(), skip(), pause().

pages.title: Queue Class
pages.purpose: Documentation for the Queue class, representing a guild's music queue and playback state.

pages.title: Song and Playlist
pages.purpose: Reference for Song and Playlist structures, including metadata like duration, thumbnail, and source.

pages.title: Plugin System
pages.purpose: Overview of DisTube's extensible plugin architecture.

page_notes.content: Explain how plugins enable support for YouTube, Spotify, SoundCloud, etc.

pages.title: Official Plugins
pages.purpose: List and link to official @distube plugins (YouTube, Spotify, etc.) with usage examples.

pages.title: Custom Plugins
pages.purpose: Guide for advanced users to create their own extractor or info extractor plugins.

pages.title: Audio Effects & Filters
pages.purpose: Documentation for applying audio filters like bassboost, nightcore, etc.

page_notes.content: Explain how to use built-in filters and define custom ones.

pages.title: Internal Architecture
pages.purpose: Dedicated section for internal library logic, core classes, and development guidelines. Only relevant for DisTube contributors.

page_notes.content: This section should be isolated from general user guides. This section is the ONLY place for detailed internal workflows like Initialization and Playback flow.

pages.title: Core Logic
pages.purpose: Explain internal handlers like DisTubeHandler, DisTubeStream, and DisTubeVoice.

pages.title: Managers
pages.purpose: Document internal managers like QueueManager, DisTubeVoiceManager, and FilterManager.

pages.title: Contributing Guide
pages.purpose: Instructions for setting up the development environment, running tests, and submitting pull requests.

pages.title: Dev and Testing
pages.purpose: Deep dive into the testing framework (Vitest) and debugging internal issues.
